intro: Bulbostylis ugandensis, commonly known as the Uganda bulbostylis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flower heads. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or marshy areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
